title: US Drone Attacks in Pakistan - Obama Administration
name: US Drone Attacks in Pakistan - Obama Administration
description:
The approximate locations of U.S. drone attacks in Pakistan since 2004. Strikes  during the Obama administration. Most strikes are on Pashtun villages in North and South Waziristan in the Federally Administered Tribal Areas along the Afghan border.

this is a derivative work of http://finder.geocommons.com/overlays/34025

properties.description: 2 senior al-Qaeda leaders, Usama al-Kini and Sheikh Ahmed Salim Swedan, killed in a missile strike. Both men had long been on the FBI's Most Wanted list for their role in the 1998 U.S. Embassy bombings in Kenya and Tanzania.

In the first attacks since Barack Obama became US president, at least 14 killed in Waziristan in 2 separate attacks by 5 missiles fired from drones. Missile #1 hit a house in a village called Zarakai near the town of Mirali, North Waziristan.

In the first attacks since Barack Obama became US president, at least 14 killed in Waziristan in 2 separate attacks by 5 missiles fired from drones. Missile #2 was aimed at the house of a Taliban commander about 6 miles from Wana, South Waziristan.
More than 30 killed when two missiles are launched by drones near town of Makin in South Waziristan.
Strike in Baggan village in the Kurram Valley kills 30, reportedly at a Taliban training camp for fighters preparing to combat coalition forces in Afghanistan.
Strike in Sararogha village in South Waziristan kills 7 people.
24 killed in attack in Berju in Kurram Agency.
4 killed in Jani Khel in Bannu district in North-West Frontier Province.
7 killed in attacks on 2 vehicles by two missiles in Makin area of South Waziristan.
A strike killed 4 militants in the Essokhel area, around 19 miles east of Mir Ali town in the North Waziristan tribal region.
14 killed in Orakzai Agency tribal area.
13 killed in North Waziristan, 20 miles west of the region's main town of Miranshah.
4 killed in attack on a vehicle in Gangi Khel in South Waziristan.
At least 3 killed and 5 injured in an attack in South Waziristan.
Strike in Kanni Garam village in South Waziristan kills 6 people.
A strike in Sararogha in South Waziristan kills 6 people.
A strike in Sra Khawra village in South Waziristan kills 8 people.

A strike in the village of Sarkai Naki in North Waziristan kills 25 people. Many of the dead were Pakistani militants belonging to a group led by Hafiz Gul Bahadar. A Pakistani intelligence official identified one of the Arab men killed by the drone airstrike as Asad al-Misri.
A strike on a vehicle in South Waziristan kills 5 people.
A strike in Shahalam village in South Waziristan kills 5 people.

An airstrike in Makin kills over 60 people but misses Baitullah Mehsud. Many of the dead were attending the funerals of people killed in air strikes earlier that day. The strike is likely the deadliest drone attack to date.

A strike in Neej Narai in South Waziristan kills at least 8 people. The remote area, about 65 kilometers north of the main district town of Wana, is under the control of Baitullah Mehsud's Tehreek-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP).
US Drone kills 17 people and injures a further 27.
A strike on a militant compound in the Zangarha area 9 miles north-east of the town of Ladha in South Waziristan kills at least 12 people.
A strike on a hideout in Karwan Manza area, some six miles south-east of Ladha, kills at least 10 militants. and on a vehicle convoy in South Waziristan kills at least 50 people.
In the second attack of the day, 40 militants died when five missiles hit a vehicle convoy on the main road between Ladha and Sararogha in South Waziristan.
A strike on a house in North Waziristan, 19 miles from Miranshah, kills 4 people.
A strike in the Zangar area of South Waziristan killed 12, including Baitullah Mehsud, his wife, and his wife's parents. The Pakistani Taliban leader's death was confirmed after weeks of uncertainty.
A strike in Ladha village, South Waziristan, kills 10.
A missile strike on the village of Darpa Kheil, North Waziristan, reportedly targeting Sirajuddin Haqqani, kills at least 21 people.
A missile strike on the Tapar Ghai area in the Kanigram district of South Waziristan kills 8 people. One of the dead was reportedly Tohir Yoâ€˜ldosh, leader of the Islamic Movement of Uzbekistan.

Drone-fired missiles kill 10 in Dargamandi, North Waziristan. The attack may have killed al-Qaeda leaders Ilyas Kashmiri and Mustafa al Jaziri, as well as three Punjabi militants and two or three local Taliban fighters.
Drone-fired missile kills four people in a car 1.5 miles from Mir Ali in North Waziristan.
Drone-fired missile kills up to 12 people in the village of Dande Darpa Khel near Mir Ali.
In the first strike of the day, a drone attack reportedly kills six Taliban, including two Uzbek fighters and Taliban commander Irfan Mehsud, in a compound in Sararogha village, South Waziristan.
In the second strike of the day, a missile killed seven insurgents in a house in Dande Darpa Khel village, North Waziristan.
U.S. drone missile kills at least four people in Darpa Khel in North Waziristan.

A U.S. drone missile killed two or three alleged militants in Spalaga, North Waziristan, in territory controlled by Hafiz Gul Bahadur. One of those killed was reportedly Abu Ayyub al-Masri (not the same as Abu Ayyub al-Masri, the al-Qaeda in Iraq leader), an explosives expert for al-Qaeda and a "Tier 1" target of US counter-terrorism operations.

A U.S. drone strike kills 27 in Damadolla, inside Bajaur tribal agency. The 27 victims were reportedly a mix of Taliban and al-Qaeda operatives in a strategy meeting. The dead include 11 "foreigners." One of those reported killed is Faqir Mohammed's nephew, Zahid, and another is Mohammed's unnamed son-in-law. The meeting was apparently being held to decide on whether to reinforce South Wazaristan against Pakistani forces.
2 killed in Miranshah, North Waziristan.
4 killed and 5 injured in Shanakhora village of North Waziristan, 12 miles south of Miranshah.
8 killed in the Machikhel area near the town of Mir Ali.
3 killed in a car near Miranshah in North Waziristan, reportedly including 2 al-Qaeda members. Senior al-Qaeda planner Saleh al-Somali, a Somali citizen, is believed to have died in this strike.
Six killed in Tanga, Ladha, South Waziristan, four of whom are al-Qaeda -- and two Taliban.
In the second attack of the day, 10 missiles fired by five drones hit two compounds in Ambarshaga, killing 15 people. Unnamed sources stated that seven of the dead were "foreigners."
17 killed in 2 separate attacks in North Waziristan in an area controlled by Hafiz Gul Bahadur. In the first attack, two missiles hit a car near Dosali, killing two.
3 killed in an attack in Dattakhel region in North Waziristan.
13 killed in an attack in Saidgai village in North Waziristan.

At least 3 killed in an attack in Machikhel village in North Waziristan. According to The Frontier Post, senior Taliban leader and strong Haqqani ally Haji Omar Khan, brother of Arif Khan, was killed in the strike, along with the son of local tribal leader Karim Khan.
A missile strike on a vehicle near Ghundikala village in North Waziristan kills 3.
5 militants including 3 Arabs killed in an attack on Mosakki village around Mir Ali, North Waziristan.

2 separate missile strikes one hour apart kill approximately 20-25 people in Sanzalai village, North Waziristan. The attacks were the deadliest since a suicide bomber killed 7 CIA officers and injured 6 others at Forward Operating Base Chapman in Afghanistan, used by the CIA to coordinate drone attacks in Pakistan.
A missile strike in Tappi village in North Waziristan kills 5 people. All the militants killed were local and attached to Taliban Commander Hafiz Gul Bahadur.

Strike kills one of FBI's most wanted terrorists: Jamal Saeed Abdul Rahim, a member of al-Qaeda and Abu Nidal. In total, 4 killed and 3 injured when 2 missiles are fired on a compound in Ismail Khan in North Waziristan, which is territory of the Haqqani network.

Pakistani Taliban leader Hakimullah Mehsud is reportedly killed in an attack that kills 15 militants in Shaktoi, South Waziristan. Also, Abdul Basit Usman, a member of Filipino Islamist group Abu Sayyaf, is killed in the attack.
A drone missile attack killed five militants in Zanini, outside Mir Ali in North Waziristan.
Second missile strike of the day kills 6 in Bichi village in North Waziristan.

In the 9th drone attack of 2010, four missiles slammed into a house in the Shaktoi area of South Waziristan. The house targeted was used by Usman Jan, head of the al-Qaeda-linked Islamic Movement of Uzbekistan, Five Uzbeks were killed in the strike, and the rest were Pakistani Taliban.
Two missiles fired at a compound in the Booya village of the Datakhel sub-division, 20 miles west of Miranshah in North Waziristan kill at least 6 militants.
An unmanned aircraft went down about 8 p.m. (10 a.m. EST) near the village of Hamzoni in North Waziristan, about 3 miles west of Miran Shah
A US drone crashes 2.5 miles from the town of Miranshah, and local tribesmen claim they shot it down -- the 2nd to be hit in as many days.
Nine suspected militants were killed in a US drone strike on a militant compound in Muhammad Khel, a town in North Waziristan.

The third drone strike of the day, in the area of Khar Qamar, hit two vehicles on their way to the scene of the day's previous attacks. At least six militants were killed. In total, the day's barrage of 19 missiles from 8 drones killed an estimated 29 people.

The day's second attack took place in Mamad Khel, another part of North Waziristan that is close to Daigaan. Residents in Miran Shah said the targets of these attacks were militants who fired on the drones flying overhead. In total, the day's barrage of 19 missiles from 8 drones killed an estimated 29 people.

The first of the day's 3 attacks was when drones fired six missiles at compounds in the Daigaan area of North Waziristan, close to the border with Afghanistan about 15 miles west of Miran Shah. At least four people were killed, likely from the Haqqani network. In total, the day's barrage of 19 missiles from 8 drones killed an estimated 29 people. Source
A U.S. drone fired two missiles at a compound about 13 miles west of Miranshah, killing six militants.
Abdul Haq al-Turkistani, leader of the Turkistani Islamic Party is one of 3 militants killed when a U.S. drone targets a vehicle in the village of Tapi, about 9 miles east of Miranshah.

A drone attack targeting a suspected militant compound killed two people and wounded three others in Tabbi Took Kil, North Waziristan. Top al-Qaeda leader of Egyptian origin Sheikh Mansoor was among the dead.
A missile strike killed 4 militants in a compound in the Dandey Darpa Khel area about 3 miles from Miranshah. Muhammad Haqqani, son of Jalaluddin Haqqani, was one of the victims.

3 missiles struck a compound used by al-Qaeda-affiliated local and foreign militants in the Darga Mandi area of North Waziristan. Among the nine militants killed included Qari Zafar, carrying a reward of $5 million for his alleged involvement in the 2006 bombing of Karachi's U.S. Consulate.
Missiles fired by a US drone aircraft kill 5 suspected militants inside the compound of a veterinary hospital in Miranshah.
Two missiles fired by a drone struck a compound and three vehicles in the village of Mizar Madakhel in North Waziristan, killing at least 12 militants.
